p: The in vitro metabolic stability, expressed as predicted in vivo hepatic clearance (% of liver blood flow, LBF), of selected compounds was investigated in human and mouse liver microsomes. Following incubation in liver microsomes majority of compounds are classified as stable molecules in both species and have low predicted in vivo clearance values (<30% LBF). As exceptions to this, compounds 5e and 6 g (in mouse liver microsomes) and 6a (in both species) are characterised by moderate clearance (30–70% LBF). Compounds 6d, 6e and 6f are characterised by high clearance (>70% LBF) in mouse liver microsomes.
